result.execSummary:
The defendant Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Cyril A. Franz was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cyril A. Franz is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.
  • Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Cyril A. Franz was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

DA Snider present.
Def. present - in custody.
Atty. John Wallace present.
PSI has been received by counsel.
No corrections or additions to be made.
Recommendations by counsel.
Statements by the Court.
Ct. #4 - 10 years probation - SW - consecutive to prison sentence.
Ct. #1 and Ct. #3 - 7 1/2 years IC and 5 years ES
Ct. #5 and Ct. #6 - 1 1/2 years IC and 2 years ES
Ct. #7 - 1 1/2 years IC and 1/2 year ES
All prison sentences to run concurrently and commence forthwith.
Conditions of ES and Probation:
1.  provide DNA sample.
2.  pay costs of the action + $460.00 buy money - court obligations to be paid out of $1140.00 seized money.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments or counseling deemed appropriate by his Agent.
4.  def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
5.  def. to take prescriptions in manner and method as prescribed by his physician - def. to advise Agent of any medication changes/dr. appointments w/in 72 hours - def. to obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy.
6.  def. to obtain and maintain FT employment.
391 days credit.
The Court directs Ex. #2, #3, #4, #7, #10, #12, #19, #20, and #21 (all illegal substances) be turned over to Waupaca Co Sheriff's Dept. ATTN:  Deputy Pat McClone.

Firearm restrictions explained to def.
